arm_group.description: 1 Hz rTMS over unaffected hemisphere for 15 minutes
1Hz sham rTMS, over unaffected hemisphere for 15 minutes

brief_summary.textblock:
The substantial efficacy and the possible mechanism of repetitive transcranial magnetic
      stimulation (rTMS)  improving language recovery remained unclear. It is hypothesized that
      the rTMS was associated with increased synaptic connection and neural regeneration which can
      be evaluated via functional neuroimage and neurofiber imaging analysis. The effect of rTMS
      intervention was monitored by clinical testing and neuroimaging study.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Neuroimage in Assessment of Post-stroke Aphasia

detailed_description.textblock:
2-week rTMS modulation has been proved to produce substantial clinical benefit with
      sham-controlled study. This trial aimed to investigate the possible mechanism and make
      clinical correlation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Aphasic stroke in chronic stage (over 3 months)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  No seizure history, no brain surgery history, no electronic device in brain or chest,
             no dementia

intervention.description: To test the efficacy of this specific setting.

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 2 Study of rTMS Application in Aphasic Patients Evaluated With fMRI

overall_official.affiliation: Department of physical medicine and rehabilitation, Taipei Veterans General Hospital

primary_outcome.description: Assess the linguistic skills such as conversation, expression, description, comprehension...
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before the rTMS intervention, at 2nd week, and 3rd month

reference.citation: Tsai PY, Wang CP, Ko JS, Chung YM, Chang YW, Wang JX. The Persistent and Broadly Modulating Effect of Inhibitory rTMS in Nonfluent Aphasic Patients: A Sham-Controlled, Double-Blind Study. Neurorehabil Neural Repair. 2014 Feb 13. [Epub ahead of print]

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before rTMS intervention, and at the day completing the rTMS treatment.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
